If you enjoyed the dark and twisted vibe of Jennifer's Body, I'd recommend "Kiss Kiss Bang Bang" (2005). This action-comedy stars Robert Downey Jr. and Val Kilmer in a murder-mystery plot that's full of wit and humor. The chemistry between the leads is undeniable, and the film's clever script will keep you guessing until the very end.

Alternatively, if you're looking for something with a slightly different tone, I'd suggest "Kiss of the Dragon" (2001). This martial arts thriller stars Jet Li as an intelligence officer on the run from a deadly conspiracy. With its high-octane action sequences and intricate plot, this movie is sure to keep you on the edge of your seat!

Considering your interest in war movies and Tom Cruise, I'm going to suggest "End of Watch" (2016). It's a gritty, intense film that explores the daily struggles of two young police officers, and it has a similar tone to some of Tom Cruise's earlier war dramas. Plus, with Jake Gyllenhaal and America Ferrera starring alongside Frank Grillo, you can expect a powerful performance-driven movie.

If you're not in the mood for something as intense, I'd recommend "Restless" (2006) instead. It's a poignant coming-of-age story about two people who find meaning in each other despite their different outlooks on life. With beautiful cinematography and strong performances from Mia Wasikowska and Hayley Atwell, it's a heartwarming film that explores the human condition.
